title: Java Mathrandom()Method

metadata.description: Learn about Java Mathrandom()Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Generate a random number:
System.out.println(Math.random());

Definition and Usage
The
random()
method returns a random number between 0 and 1.
This method never returns exactly 1, but it can return 0.
Syntax
public static double random()
Technical Details
Returns:
A
double
value representing a randomly selected number between 0 and 1, excluding 1 itself.
Java version:
Any

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Java Mathrandom()Method concepts and techniques.
